org.openntf.domino.formula
Class ValueHolder

java.lang.Object
  org.openntf.domino.formula.ValueHolder
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ValueHolderBoolean, ValueHolderNumber, ValueHolderObject
public abstract class ValueHolder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This Valueholder is to hold single or multiple values. When evaluating a formula, every String/int/double value is wrapped in a "ValueHolder". The holder has several get-methods to return the different types. You always must check the datatype before calling one of the getters, because a ValueHolder that contains Strings cannot return The code itself might look strange, but this was done to be as fast as possible

Author:
Roland Praml, Foconis AG
See Also:
Serialized Form

public static ValueHolder valueOf(java.lang.Object init)
Deprecated. 

Init a ValueHolder based on a single value or a collection
If possible use one of the special "valueOf" constructors as these are faster
